what: Bayesian Basis Selection for Functional Data Using Variational Expectation-Maximization (VEM)
title: Bayesian Basis Selection for Functional Data Using Variational Expectation-Maximization (VEM)
text: VEMSmooth implements Variational Expectation-Maximization (VEM) Bayesian Basis Selection method Functional Data Analysis (FDA). builds upon work da Cruz, de Souza da Sousa (2024), providing fast, scalable Bayesian basis selection alternative. package developed part Data Science 4999z Thesis Project Western University.

title: Bayesian Basis Selection for Functional Data Using Variational Expectation-Maximization (VEM)
text: can install development version VEMSmooth GitHub :

title: Bayesian Basis Selection for Functional Data Using Variational Expectation-Maximization (VEM)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(VEMSmooth) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: checkConvergence - ELBO Convergence test — checkConvergence

checkConvergence - ELBO Convergence test — checkConvergence
text: elbo_c Current ELBO value. elbo_prev Previous ELBO value. convergence_threshold Numeric convergence threshold.

title: checkConvergence - ELBO Convergence test — checkConvergence
text: Logical; TRUE converged.

text: lambda1, lambda2 Shape scale parameters τ². delta1, delta2 Shape scale parameters σ².

title: expectedInvTerms - Expected Values for Variance Parameters (sigma and tau) — expectedInvTau2
text: Numeric expected values.

title: expectedLogLikelihood — expectedLogLikelihood
text: Internal helper functions computing Evidence Lower Bound (ELBO) components within Variational EM algorithm correlated functional data. function corresponds specific ELBO sub-term: expectedLogLikelihood(): expected log-likelihood curve. elboInclusionTerm(): contribution inclusion indicators (Z terms). elboBetaTerm(): contribution β coefficients. elboThetaTerm(): contribution θ prior parameters. elboSigmaTerm(): contribution σ² prior. elboTauTerm(): contribution τ² prior. functions internal meant called directly users. Computes expected log-likelihood term curve given correlated errors.

title: expectedLogLikelihood — expectedLogLikelihood
code: expectedLogLikelihood(   y,   ni,   B,   i,   iter,   delta1_q,   delta2_values,   mu_beta_values,   Sigma_beta,   prob_values,   psi )

title: expectedLogLikelihood — expectedLogLikelihood
text: y List observed data curve. ni Vector sample sizes per curve. B List basis matrices. Curve index. iter Current iteration index. delta1_q Shape parameter sigma²’s variational posterior. delta2_values Rate parameters sigma²’s variational posterior. mu_beta_values Posterior mean matrix beta. Sigma_beta Posterior covariance array beta. psi Correlation matrix (Ψ). p_values Matrix inclusion probabilities.

title: expectedLogLikelihood — expectedLogLikelihood
text: Numeric expected log-likelihood value.

title: expectedLogLikelihood — expectedLogLikelihood
text: helpers - elbo: ELBO component functions VEMSmooth

what: helpers - beta: beta-related expectation helpers — expectedResidualSq
title: helpers - beta: beta-related expectation helpers — expectedResidualSq
text: Expected squared residuals beta^2 moments variational posterior. used updates q(sigma^2), q(tau^2), q(Z_ki).

title: helpers - beta: beta-related expectation helpers — expectedResidualSq
code: expectedResidualSq(B, i, y, mu, Sigma, prob, iter, psi)

title: helpers - beta: beta-related expectation helpers — expectedResidualSq
text: B List basis matrices (B[] n_i x K). Curve index. y List observations (y[] length n_i vector). mu Matrix posterior beta means (rows = iterations, cols = beta_k_i). Sigma Array posterior beta covariance matrices (K x K x m). prob Matrix inclusion probabilities (rows = iterations, cols = beta_k_i). iter Current iteration index. psi Correlation matrix errors.

title: helpers - beta: beta-related expectation helpers — expectedResidualSq
text: Numeric expected squared (summed squared) values.

what: vem_smooth - Variational EM Algorithm for Bayesian Basis Selection — vem_smooth
title: vem_smooth - Variational EM Algorithm for Bayesian Basis Selection — vem_smooth
text: Runs Variational EM (VEM) algorithm smoothing functional curves via basis function selection, accounting correlated errors.

title: vem_smooth - Variational EM Algorithm for Bayesian Basis Selection — vem_smooth
code: vem_smooth(   y,   B,   Xt = seq(0, 1, length.out = max(length(y))),   m = length(y),   K = ncol(B[[1]]),   mu_ki = 0.5,   lambda_1 = 1e-10,   lambda_2 = 1e-10,   delta_1 = 1e-10,   delta_2 = 1e-10,   maxIter = 1000,   initial_values,   convergence_threshold = 0.01,   lower_opt = 0.1 )

title: vem_smooth - Variational EM Algorithm for Bayesian Basis Selection — vem_smooth
text: y List length m, element numeric vector observed curve values (ie. outcome variable). B List length m, element n_i x K matrix basis evaluations (eg. B-spline values). Xt Vector time points (assumed identical curves). m Number curves. K Number basis functions. mu_ki Hyperparameter Beta prior θ (inclusion probability). lambda_1, lambda_2 Hyperparameter inverse-gamma prior τ². delta_1, delta_2 Hyperparameters inverse-gamma prior σ². maxIter Maximum number VEM iterations. initial_values List starting values w, p, λ₂, δ₂. convergence_threshold ELBO convergence tolerance. lower_opt Lower bound w optimization.

title: vem_smooth - Variational EM Algorithm for Bayesian Basis Selection — vem_smooth
text: list containing fitted variational parameters, ELBO trajectory, convergence information final w.

title: vem_smooth - Variational EM Algorithm for Bayesian Basis Selection — vem_smooth
text: algorithm alternates : E-step: updating variartional distributions β, σ², τ², Z, θ. M-step: maximizing ELBO respect correlation parameter w.
